repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
fix(shada): prevent extui buffers from appearing in v:oldfiles

Problem: extui buffers are incorrectly added to v:oldfiles.

Solution: Use ignore_buf() consistently in shada_write() for buffer 
marks processing. Previously missed the buflisted check, causing 
unlisted extui buffers to be written to ShaDa.
<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body:
"nvim-pager" or "nvim-messages" would be a more appropriate scheme. 

idk why "extui" keeps popping up everywhere, it's not the name of this feature.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -77,7 +77,7 @@ function M.tab_check_wins()
     end
 
     if setopt then
-      api.nvim_buf_set_name(M.bufs[type], 'vim._extui.' .. type)
+      api.nvim_buf_set_name(M.bufs[type], 'extui//:vim._extui.' .. type)

comment_data.body: It's just what I named the Lua module (because it is an implementation for the external UI events). It indeed shouldn't be referenced in any documentation or user facing stuff (like the buffer name) if/when this is promoted from experimental. Would be better to figure out what these buffers would be named sooner rather than later of course. `nvim-<type>` seems fine to me.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -77,7 +77,7 @@ function M.tab_check_wins()
     end
 
     if setopt then
-      api.nvim_buf_set_name(M.bufs[type], 'vim._extui.' .. type)
+      api.nvim_buf_set_name(M.bufs[type], 'extui//:vim._extui.' .. type)

comment_data.body:
Better to just test this with a 'nobuflisted' buffer, which is what we're changing here:
```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/shada/buffers_spec.lua b/test/functional/shada/buffers_spec.lua
index e44d233dbc..ad4b36240b 100644
--- a/test/functional/shada/buffers_spec.lua
+++ b/test/functional/shada/buffers_spec.lua
@@ -92,18 +92,13 @@ describe('shada support code', function()
     eq(testfilename, fn.bufname(2))
   end)
 
-  it('does not add extui buffers to oldfiles', function()
+  it('does not add nobuflisted buffers to oldfiles', function()
     reset("set shada='100")
     nvim_command('edit ' .. testfilename)
+    nvim_command('set nobuflisted')
     nvim_command('write')
-    nvim_command('lua require("vim._extui").enable({})')
-    nvim_command('echom "hello"')
-    nvim_command('messages')
-    nvim_command('close')
     expect_exit(nvim_command, 'qall')
     reset("set shada='100")
-    local oldfiles = api.nvim_get_vvar('oldfiles')
-    eq(1, #oldfiles)
-    t.matches(testfilename:gsub('%-', '%%-') .. '$', oldfiles[1])
+    eq({}, api.nvim_get_vvar('oldfiles'))
   end)
 end)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -91,4 +91,19 @@ describe('shada support code', function()
     eq('', fn.bufname(1))
     eq(testfilename, fn.bufname(2))
   end)
+
+  it('does not add extui buffers to oldfiles', function()
+    reset("set shada='100")
+    nvim_command('edit ' .. testfilename)
+    nvim_command('write')
+    nvim_command('lua require("vim._extui").enable({})')

comment_data.body: "positive confirmation" gives more powerful tests. e.g. in this test, also open a `testfilename_2` (with 'buflisted', whereas the other is 'nobuflisted') and then assert that *only* its name appears in oldfiles.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -91,4 +91,14 @@ describe('shada support code', function()
     eq('', fn.bufname(1))
     eq(testfilename, fn.bufname(2))
   end)
+
+  it('does not add nobuflisted buffers to oldfiles', function()
+    reset("set shada='100")
+    nvim_command('edit ' .. testfilename)
+    nvim_command('set nobuflisted')
+    nvim_command('write')
+    expect_exit(nvim_command, 'qall')
+    reset("set shada='100")
+    eq({}, api.nvim_get_vvar('oldfiles'))

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  it("does not add 'nobuflisted' buffers to v:oldfiles", function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -91,4 +91,14 @@ describe('shada support code', function()
     eq('', fn.bufname(1))
     eq(testfilename, fn.bufname(2))
   end)
+
+  it('does not add nobuflisted buffers to oldfiles', function()

@@ -91,4 +91,18 @@ describe('shada support code', function()
     eq('', fn.bufname(1))
     eq(testfilename, fn.bufname(2))
   end)
+
+  it("does not add 'nobuflisted' buffers to 'v:oldfiles'", function()
+    reset("set shada='100")
+    nvim_command('edit ' .. testfilename)
+    nvim_command('setlocal nobuflisted')
+    nvim_command('edit ' .. testfilename_2)
+    nvim_command('setlocal buflisted')
+    nvim_command('write')
+    expect_exit(nvim_command, 'qall')
+    reset("set shada='100")
+    local oldfiles = api.nvim_get_vvar('oldfiles')
+    eq(1, #oldfiles)
+    t.matches(testfilename_2:gsub('%-', '%%-') .. '$', oldfiles[1])

comment_data.body: `v:oldfiles` is not an option. single quotes are for options.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -91,4 +91,18 @@ describe('shada support code', function()
     eq('', fn.bufname(1))
     eq(testfilename, fn.bufname(2))
   end)
+
+  it("does not add 'nobuflisted' buffers to 'v:oldfiles'", function()

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  it("does not add 'nobuflisted' buffers to v:oldfiles", function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -91,4 +91,18 @@ describe('shada support code', function()
     eq('', fn.bufname(1))
     eq(testfilename, fn.bufname(2))
   end)
+
+  it("does not add 'nobuflisted' buffers to 'v:oldfiles'", function()

comment_regular_data.body: The buffer is created as a scratch buffer with nvim_create_buf(), so 'buftype' should already be set to "nofile"?
oh seems like `nvim_buf_set_name` set `b_ffname` then `ignore_buf` return false. maybe set name to somethins like `extui://` or `'[extui:' .. type .. ']'` ..
Do you have a repro for this? The scratch buffer should also have set 'nobuflisted', so `ignore_buf()` should always return `true`?

> see here. !buf->b_p_bl

So why is 'nobuflisted' not working?

No objections to the prefix if it solves a problem. But the name should probably not include extui twice.
Yes but its an OR condition, so the `v:oldfiles` code must not check `ignore_buf()` and maybe should?
I would guess that `shada.c` should use `ignore_buf()` consistently, rather than `ignore_buf()` in some places and a similar but less extensive condition in others?

> So why is 'nobuflisted' not working?

'buflisted' has a tendency to get set by vim/nvim whenever a buffer is focused or edited. Not sure if it's a bug, but something I have noticed when working on plugins.

So the logic may need to set it again whenever it "edits" the pager buffer.
There is two more instances of `buf->ffname == NULL | set_has(removable_bufs)` guards in `shada_write()` which should maybe also use `ignore_buf()`.

title: fix(shada): prevent nobuflisted buffers from appearing in v:oldfiles
